title: Butter chicken (Rice bowls)
content:
460 calories 
38 grams protein 
50 carbs 
11 grams of fat 

(Butter chicken only) 
260 calories 
34g protein 
7g carbs 
11g fat

Ingredients- 
30g butter 
2 onions, chopped 
2 tbsp tomato paste
2 tbsp garlic paste 
2 tbsp ginger paste 
2 tbsp paprika 
1 tsp cayenne pepper 
2 tbsp garam masala 
1 tsp cumin 
1 tsp coriander 
2 tsp salt 
Dash black pepper

1x 14oz can crushed fire roasted tomatoes 
1/2 cup water 

Optional to add when blending- 
1 tbsp chicken bouillon 
1 tbsp sugar/0 cal sweetener 

32 oz diced chicken breast 

Crockpot-
High 2-3 hours 
Low 3-4 hours 

250g plain nonfat green yogurt 
30g butter 

For rice bowls- 
420g basmati rice 
~630 ml water 
Cook and evenly distro for 7 servings 

Sauté onions in butter, add all listed spices over sautéd onions and cook until evenly mixed 

Pour onion/spice mix into blender and blend until creamy. 

Add 32oz chicken to crockpot and pour the mix you just made over the chicken. Cook on high 2-3 hours or low 3-4 hours 

Once finished add butter and Greek yogurt to the pot and stir until evenly mixed. 

Make 7 servings of basmati rice and serve butter chicken over rice.
Veggie enchiladas 
4 tortillas, warmed up in paper towel in microwave
1 can black beans
1/2 red onion, diced
1 or 2 bell peppers, any color, diced or sliced
1 packet taco seasoning
2 medium sweet potatoes
1 1/2T olive oil
1T paprika
1t chili powder
1t turmeric
1 large can mild red enchilada sauce (Old El Paso brand is our fav)
1/2 cup Mexican cheese

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Prepare sweet potatoes by peeling and cutting into small cubes. Place on medium to large sized sheet pan covered with parchment paper and coat in ~1T of olive oil. Sprinkle paprika, chili powder, and turmeric and toss the diced sweet potatoes to evenly cover. Put sweet potatoes in the oven for ~15-20 mins. 

While the sweet potatoes cook, drain and rinse the black beans. Heat 1/2T of olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add diced red onions and diced/sliced bell peppers. Allow to cook for 3-5 minutes before adding in black beans. Cool for another 2-3 minutes. Add in taco seasoning and stir to coat evenly. Let sit in the pan on the burner, but turn the heat off. 

Once the sweet potatoes are done, remove from oven and combine with the black beans. Stir evenly. Turn oven to 350 degrees. Place a heaping scoop of the black bean & sweet potato mixture into each of the 4 tortillas. Roll tortillas up, but don’t fold in the ends. Place into glass or ceramic pan. Once all tortillas are filled and in the pan, coat evenly with the enchilada sauce. Make sure you shimmy the enchiladas around to get the sauce in between each enchilada. Add Mexican cheese. 

Place the glass or ceramic pan in the oven (at 350 degrees) and let cook for 10-15 minutes, or until cheese is melted. Remove from oven and let cool for 5-10 minutes. Serve!

title: Carne Asada Street Tacos
content:
Ingredients:

1 pound skirt steak (or flank)
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 cup orange juice
1 lime (juiced)
1 tablespoon chopped cilantro
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon fresh ground pepper
2 teaspoons cumin
5 cloves garlic (cracked)
Instructions:

Marinate the steak with olive oil, orange juice, lime juice, cilantro, salt, pepper, cumin, and garlic for at least 1 hour.
Grill the steak to your desired doneness and slice thinly.
Serve on warm tortillas with your favorite toppings like diced onions, cilantro, and lime juice
